column4: is there a good program to manage mp3's, something that will help me rotate the songs that are on my portable mp3 player from the songs that are on my hard drive?
i'm looking at rhythmbox, but it doesn't seem to have the capability to actually *move* mp3's
perhaps i'm wrong, in which case, somebody please correct me.
rhythmbox is a *player*, nt a mangar
you should tell that to whoever put "management" in the about screen ;)
the about box was written by "management"
nice.
no, that's not what you mean :)
it depends on how many 9's there are.
if there are enough nines, it is actually 2.
and you can never step into the same river :)
I wasn't being flippant, it's an old greek philosophy joke
oh, i don't get it.  in any case, i was being a math nerd for a second.
then you know that you can always halve the distance, and never reach the destination :)
sure
ok
what's so special about thomas guide that makes it difficult to use under qemu?
huh?  can't you set the command line paramter telling it to map /dev/cdrom to the d: drive?
i don't have much experience with qemu, but i successfully installed windows 2k off a cd.
strange.
how about copying an installation over the network into qemu?
I se what you mean, sorry about that
